channel.title: Make files hidden
channel.description: How would i hide files? For anti leeching purposes?

item.title: Make files hidden
item.dc:creator: @Jamie1200 Jamie1200
item.description:
@Jamie1200 wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:4, topic:399144”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=496278.msg3628115#msg3628115 date=1307997801]
Not that it helps you at all, as someone can show hidden files just as easy.
[/quote]
If they know what and how to work a computer’s basic function.

OT: You should also delete the .Java files as well, a little more antileech protection.[/quote]

until you compile…

Read full topic

item.title: Make files hidden
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

  1. With the client, they can decompile all classes, etc. with little effort.
  2. Clicking “hidden” does almost nothing. If you use linux, you’re familiar with the dot notation for hiding files/folders. I always have “Show hidden files and folders” on.
  3. You can do “attrib +s +h files” so that even if they have “Show hidden files and folders” on they can’t see the files.

Read full topic

item.title: Make files hidden
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

If you hide a file you can show it. I just delete all java files. And Jar the rest and make the .BAT load the Jar file. It sort of works.

Read full topic

item.title: Make files hidden
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Windows hidden files aren’t hidden on linux he means

item.title: Make files hidden
item.dc:creator: @i_have_an_ax i have an ax
item.description:
@i_have_an_ax wrote:

[quote=“cedaw, post:6, topic:399144”][quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=496278.msg3628113#msg3628113 date=1307997756]
Highlight all the files and right click them, go to proprieties and then click on ‘Hidden’.
[/quote]

implying that crosses over to the linux workstation!!![/quote]
?

Read full topic
